metadata.goal_text: The student can partition a number line into equal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1. Place a [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] to divide it into two equal parts.

prompt.text: Partition the number line into 2 equal parts.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Place the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] right in the middle.

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_2
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/2 mark

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_cut_hint_1_2] To make two equal parts, the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] needs to go exactly halfway between 0 and 1.

events.name: A_cut_1_2
events.description: Partition the shape in half (1/2)

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to do this. [event:A_cut_1_2] To divide the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into two equal parts, we place the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at the halfway point. See how this creates two intervals that are exactly the same length? That's how halves work - 2 equal parts make a whole.

on_correct.dialogue: Good. You divided the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into halves.

metadata.goal_text: The student can partition a number line into equal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar divided into three equal parts. Place tick marks on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to match it.

prompt.text: Partition the number line into thirds.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Place two tick marks to create three equal parts.

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_3
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/3 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_2_3
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 2/3 mark

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. Look at the bar - it has three equal parts. [event:A_cut_hint_1_3][event:A_cut_hint_2_3] You need to place tick marks at these same positions on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_cut_1_3
events.description: Make a cut at 1/3 mark

events.name: A_cut_2_3
events.description: Make a cut at 2/3 mark

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to do this. To match the bar's three equal parts, we need to place [event:A_cut_1_3][event:A_cut_2_3] tick marks at one-third and two-thirds. See how this creates three [vocab]equal intervals[/vocab] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab], just like the three equal parts in the bar? That's how thirds work on a number line.

on_correct.dialogue: Good. You partitioned the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into three equal parts.

metadata.goal_text: The student can partition a number line into equal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1. Place tick marks to divide it into four equal parts.

prompt.text: Partition the number line into 4 equal parts.

step.dialogue: Check the spacing between your tick marks.

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_2
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/2 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_4
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_3_4
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 3/4 mark

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. To make four equal parts, each section needs to be the same distance. [event:A_cut_hint_1_2][event:A_cut_hint_1_4][event:A_cut_hint_3_4] Try placing your tick marks at these positions.

events.name: A_cut_1_2
events.description: Partition the shape in half (1/2)

events.name: A_cut_1_4
events.description: Make a cut at 1/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_3_4
events.description: Make a cut at 3/4 mark

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to divide this into fourths. First, we place a tick [event:A_cut_1_2] at the halfway point. Then we divide each half in half again by placing ticks [event:A_cut_1_4][event:A_cut_3_4] at the one-fourth and three-fourths marks. See how all four sections are exactly the same size? That's how fourths work on a [vocab]number line[/vocab].

on_correct.dialogue: Good. You divided the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into fourths.

metadata.goal_text: The student can partition a number line into equal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar divided into six equal parts. Place tick marks on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] to match it.

prompt.text: Partition the number line into equal parts to match the bar.

step.dialogue: Check the spacing between your tick marks.

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_6
events.description: Show visual guide for placing tick at 1/6 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_2_6
events.description: Show visual guide for placing tick at 2/6 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_4_6
events.description: Show visual guide for placing tick at 4/6 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_5_6
events.description: Show visual guide for placing tick at 5/6 mark

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The bar shows six equal parts, so you need five tick marks that divide the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into six equal spaces. [event:A_cut_hint_1_6][event:A_cut_hint_2_6][event:A_cut_hint_4_6][event:A_cut_hint_5_6] Here's where each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] should go.

events.name: A_cut_1_6
events.description: Place tick mark at 1/6 position

events.name: A_cut_2_6
events.description: Place tick mark at 2/6 position

events.name: A_cut_4_6
events.description: Place tick mark at 4/6 position

events.name: A_cut_5_6
events.description: Place tick mark at 5/6 position

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to [vocab]partition[/vocab] this [vocab]number line[/vocab]. The bar has six equal parts, so we need five tick marks to create six [vocab]equal intervals[/vocab]. [event:A_cut_1_6][event:A_cut_2_6][event:A_cut_4_6][event:A_cut_5_6] First, we place a tick at one-sixth, then at two-sixths, then we skip the middle and place ticks at four-sixths and five-sixths. See how each space between the ticks is exactly the same size, matching the bar? That's how sixths work on a number line.

on_correct.dialogue: You partitioned the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into sixths.

metadata.goal_text: The student can partition a number line into equal parts.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1. Place tick marks to divide it into 8 equal parts.

prompt.text: Partition the number line into eighths.

step.dialogue: Check the spacing between your tick marks.

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_2
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/2 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_1_4
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 1/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_3_4
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape at 3/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_hint_8
events.description: Show visual guide for cutting shape into eighths

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. To make eighths, you need 7 tick marks that divide the line into 8 equal parts. [event:A_cut_hint_1_2] Start by finding the halfway point, [event:A_cut_hint_1_4][event:A_cut_hint_3_4] then divide each half into fourths, [event:A_cut_hint_8] and finally divide those into eighths.

events.name: A_cut_1_2
events.description: Partition the shape in half (1/2)

events.name: A_cut_1_4
events.description: Make a cut at 1/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_3_4
events.description: Make a cut at 3/4 mark

events.name: A_cut_8
events.description: Make a cut at 1/2 mark, then cut each half into fourths to create eighths

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to [vocab]partition[/vocab] this into eighths. [event:A_cut_1_2] First, we place a tick at the halfway point - that's [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one half[/fraction]. [event:A_cut_1_4][event:A_cut_3_4] Now we divide each half in half again - that gives us [fraction numerator=1 denominator=4]one fourth[/fraction] and [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4]three fourths[/fraction]. [event:A_cut_8] Finally, we divide each of those sections in half to create eighths at [fraction numerator=1 denominator=8]one eighth[/fraction], [fraction numerator=2 denominator=8]two eighths[/fraction], [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8]three eighths[/fraction], [fraction numerator=4 denominator=8]four eighths[/fraction], [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8]five eighths[/fraction], [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction], and [fraction numerator=7 denominator=8]seven eighths[/fraction]. See how all 8 parts are exactly the same size? That's how eighths work - 8 equal parts make a whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You partitioned the [vocab]number line[/vocab] into eighths.
